SourceString: Whether to hide the currently equipped helmet (or other headwear) on your character.
Whether to automatically equip newly picked up items. Disabling this allows builds that rely on keeping certain item slots empty.

Control if the game is allowed to collect and send data to THQ Nordic for analytics purposes.\nWe would love to have your help in improving the game by contributing usage data. This only includes information on how you play the game, and does not involve any personal identification data or unique device information.
Size of the mouse cursor. Default: Auto - attempts to pick the best cursor size for your game UI resolution.
Which item color scheme to use.\nDefault: A new color scheme tailored to make item colors more distinct and follow ARPG genre conventions.\nLegacy: The classic \'Titan Quest\' item colors
Always display stats values on the health and mana orbs in the HUD.
Show reserved energy values on orbs.
This will reset all tutorials, causing them to appear during gameplay again. Do you want to continue?

Whether to allow quick, unimpeded skipping through dialogues.\nEnabling this option will allow you to skip over single-choice dialogue responses. This may cause you to miss some context when skipping through dialogues, not recommended for players interested in the story.
When to show the over-head health bar of the local player character.
When to show the over-head health bar of other players\' characters.
When to show the over-head health bar of enemies.
When to show the over-head health bar of friendly and neutral non-player characters.
When to show the over-head name of the local player character.
When to show the over-head name of other players\' characters.
When to show the over-head name of enemies.
When to show the over-head name of friendly and neutral non-player characters.
Using the provided images, test out the different color blind modes to find a color correction that works best for you.
Using the provided images, test out the different strengths to find a color correction that works best for you.
Whether to show damage floating combat text popups.
Whether to show heal floating combat text popups.
Whether to show immune floating combat text popups.
Whether to show experience floating combat text popups.
Defines when loot plates are shown and how to change their visibility.
Should loot plates be shown in combat?
Defines when loot plates are interactable and how to change their interactability.
Should loot plates be interactable in combat?
Defines when loot tooltips are shown and how to change their visibility.
Should loot tooltips be visible in combat?
Whether to give audio feedback when an ability cannot be executed, e.g. due to cooldowns or mana cost.
You will need to restart the game completely for all language related changes to take effect.
Whether the comparison tooltip is shown while the button is held or whether it can be toggled on or off.
Units used to display distance measurements in tooltips.
Whether to show content related to any currently running seasonal events.
